N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4236.4 - Trainer's responsibility

State Regulations
A trainer shall be responsible at all times for the
condition of all horses trained by him. No trainer shall start or permit a
horse in his custody, care or control to be started if he knows, or he might
have known or have cause to believe, that the horse has received any drug or
other restricted substance that could result in a positive test. The trainer
shall be held responsible for any positive test unless he can show by
substantial evidence that neither he nor any employee nor agent was responsible
for the administration of the drug or other restricted substance. Every trainer
must guard each horse trained by him in such manner and for such period of time
prior to racing the horse so as to prevent any person whether or not employed
by or connected with the owner or trainer from administering any drug or other
restricted substance to such horse contrary to this Part. Notes
